import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
from math import sqrt

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
# Fill missing values
train_data.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)
test_data.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_features = ['MSSubClass', 'MSZoning', 'LotShape', 'LandContour', 'Utilities', 'LotConfig', 'LandSlope', 'Neighborhood', 'Condition1', 'Condition2', 'BldgType', 'HouseStyle', 'RoofStyle', 'RoofMatl', 'Exterior1st', 'Exterior2nd', 'MasVnrType', 'ExterQual', 'ExterCond', 'Foundation', 'BsmtQual', 'BsmtCond', 'BsmtExposure', 'BsmtFinType1', 'BsmtFinType2', 'Heating', 'CentralAir', 'Electrical', 'GarageType', 'GarageFinish', 'PavedDrive', 'MiscFeature']
for col in categorical_features:
    train_data[col] = pd.Categorical(train_data[col])
    test_data[col] = pd.Categorical(test_data[col])

# Get dummy variables
train_data = pd.get_dummies(train_data)
test_data = pd.get_dummies(test_data)

# Split features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Define model and hyperparameters
rf_model = RandomForestRegressor()
param_grid = {
    'n_estimators': [100, 200, 300],
    'max_depth': [None, 10, 20, 30],
    'min_samples_split': [2, 5, 10]
}

# Hyperparameter tuning using GridSearchCV
grid_search = GridSearchCV(rf_model, param_grid, cv=5, scoring='neg_mean_squared_error')
grid_search.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Best model
best_rf_model = grid_search.best_estimator_

# Predict on validation set
X_val = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')
X_val.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)
X_val = pd.get_dummies(X_val)[X_train.columns]
y_pred = best_rf_model.predict(X_val)

# Calculate RMSE
rmse = sqrt(mean_squar

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
from math import sqrt

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
# Fill missing values
train_data.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)
test_data.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_features = ['MSSubClass', 'MSZoning', 'LotShape', 'LandContour', 'Utilities', 'LotConfig', 'LandSlope', 'Neighborhood', 'Condition1', 'Condition2', 'BldgType', 'HouseStyle', 'RoofStyle', 'RoofMatl', 'Exterior1st', 'Exterior2nd', 'MasVnrType', 'ExterQual', 'ExterCond', 'Foundation', 'BsmtQual', 'BsmtCond', 'BsmtExposure', 'BsmtFinType1', 'BsmtFinType2', 'Heating', 'CentralAir', 'Electrical', 'GarageType', 'GarageFinish', 'PavedDrive', 'MiscFeature', 'SaleType', 'SaleCondition']

    train_data[col] = pd.Categorical(train_data[col])
    test_data[col] = pd.Categorical(test_data[col])

# Get dummy variables
train_data = pd.get_dummies(train_data)
test_data = pd.get_dummies(test_data)

# Ensure both datasets have the same columns
common_columns = train_data.columns.intersection(test_data.columns)
train_data = train_data[common_columns]
test_data = test_data[common_columns]

}

grid_search.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Best model
best_rf_model = grid_search.best_estimator_

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
from math import sqrt

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
# Fill missing values
train_data.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)
test_data.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_features = ['MSSubClass', 'MSZoning', 'LotShape', 'LandContour', 'Utilities', 'LotConfig', 'LandSlope', 'Neighborhood', 'Condition1', 'Condition2', 'BldgType', 'HouseStyle', 'RoofStyle', 'RoofMatl', 'Exterior1st', 'Exterior2nd', 'MasVnrType', 'ExterQual', 'ExterCond', 'Foundation', 'BsmtQual', 'BsmtCond', 'BsmtExposure', 'BsmtFinType1', 'BsmtFinType2', 'Heating', 'CentralAir', 'Electrical', 'GarageType', 'GarageFinish', 'PavedDrive', 'MiscFeature', 'SaleType', 'SaleCondition']
for col in categorical_features:
    train_data[col] = pd.Categorical(train_data[col])
    test_data[col] = pd.Categorical(test_data[col])

# Get dummy variables
train_data = pd.get_dummies(train_data)
test_data = pd.get_dummies(test_data)

# Ensure both datasets have the same columns
common_columns = train_data.columns.intersection(test_data.columns)
train_data = train_data[common_columns]
test_data = test_data[common_columns]

# Split features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Define model and hyperparameters
rf_model = RandomForestRegressor()
param_grid = {
    'n_estimators': [100, 200, 300],
    'max_depth': [None, 10, 20, 30],
    'min_samples_split': [2, 5, 10]
}

# Hyperparameter tuning using GridSearchCV
grid_search = GridSearchCV(rf_model, param_grid, cv=5, scoring='neg_mean_squared_error')
grid_search.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Best model
best_rf_model = grid_search.best_estimator_

# Predict on valid

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
from math import sqrt

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
# Fill missing values
train_data.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)
test_data.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_features = ['MSSubClass', 'MSZoning', 'LotShape', 'LandContour', 'Utilities', 'LotConfig', 'LandSlope', 'Neighborhood', 'Condition1', 'Condition2', 'BldgType', 'HouseStyle', 'RoofStyle', 'RoofMatl', 'Exterior1st', 'Exterior2nd', 'MasVnrType', 'ExterQual', 'ExterCond', 'Foundation', 'BsmtQual', 'BsmtCond', 'BsmtExposure', 'BsmtFinType1', 'BsmtFinType2', 'Heating', 'CentralAir', 'Electrical', 'GarageType', 'GarageFinish', 'PavedDrive', 'MiscFeature', 'SaleType', 'SaleCondition']
for col in categorical_features:
    train_data[col] = pd.Categorical(train_data[col])
    test_data[col] = pd.Categorical(test_data[col])

# Get dummy variables
train_data = pd.get_dummies(train_data)
test_data = pd.get_dummies(test_data)

# Ensure both datasets have the same columns
common_columns = train_data.columns.intersection(test_data.columns)
train_data = train_data[common_columns]
test_data = test_data[common_columns]

# Split features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Define model and hyperparameters
rf_model = RandomForestRegressor()
param_grid = {
    'n_estimators': [100, 200, 300],
    'max_depth': [None, 10, 20, 30],
    'min_samples_split': [2, 5, 10]
}

# Hyperparameter tuning using GridSearchCV
grid_search = GridSearchCV(rf_model, param_grid, cv=5, scoring='neg_mean_squared_error')
grid_search.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Best model
best_rf_model = grid_search.best_estimator_

# Predict on valid
